node.title: Tired of having her heart broken trying to buy a home, Alannah attempted to beat the system
node.alt: A woman with long hair smiling.
node.description: After having several offers on homes knocked back, Alannah Edyvane says she came up with a way to gauge which houses were being underquoted.
node.content:
["Alannah Edyvane and her partner could see their chances of becoming home owners slipping away, having had several of their offers knocked back by agents.\u00a0", "\"I think we've put in six or seven\u00a0offers from $20,000 to $100,000 over the asking price, and we didn't get any of them,\" she said.\u00a0", "Ms Edyvane was looking for properties roughly priced at $750,000 and located in the outskirts of Melbourne. She said\u00a0she was constantly inspecting homes that had been underquoted.\u00a0", "\"We would often offer the agent the top of the listed price or over and they would reject it.\"", "It made viewing properties a deflating experience.", "\"We would get really excited and picture ourselves living in that home and we'd just have our hopes dashed, because we were never really a chance,\" she said.\u00a0", "In the past year, property prices have risen more than 21 per cent and industry experts forecast\u00a0no end\u00a0in sight as people rush to get into property ownership.", "
Underquoting 'endemic' according to expert
", "", "
Underquoting is a \"grubby tool\u00a0estate agents use to get people to view properties\", says\u00a0David Morrell.(ABC News: John Gunn)
", "Underquoting is the practice of deliberately pricing a property for less than it will fetch on the open market.", "Consumer Affairs Victoria recently audited 29 real estate agencies after a tip-off from the public.", "It found that 17 of them were underquoting.\u00a0", "But buyer's advocate\u00a0David Morrell believed\u00a0up to 80 per cent\u00a0of properties on the market were not accurately quoted.", "\"Any professional that's been in the industry for a long time could accurately predict a property within 5-10 per cent of its sale price. [Underquoting is]\u00a0a grubby tool estate agents use to get people to view properties.\"", "He said that underquoting was part of the cultural fabric of realtors across the country and recent legislative changes attempting to crack down on the practice had\u00a0failed.\u00a0", "\"There's an old adage: 'Quote them low, watch 'em go. Quote em high, watch them die.'\u00a0A\u00a0leopard\u00a0never changes its spots,\" he said.", "\"The current legislation is ineffective. Consumer Affairs have tried to fix it but it's like putting the finger in the dyke. They haven't had any real success\".", "
Soaring prices
", "", "
Property prices have risen more than 21 per cent in the last year.(ABC News: Ian Cutmore)
", "The peak body for realtors in Victoria, the Real Estate Institute of Victoria (REIV), had previously worked with Consumer Affairs to crack down on underquoting and insists the practice is infrequent across the country.", "President Adam Docking believed\u00a0the soaring price of houses was making it difficult for agents to accurately quote.", "\"The price the property is marketed at is an indication of where the agent sees the market price of the property. At auction day competition can take it well in advance of that range,\" Mr Docking said.\u00a0", "\"To turn up to an auction and the price go way above what you're expecting is very difficult. It could be that market forces are pushing the price right up.", "\"If there is underquoting, name them and fine them, but often it's just someone who wants the property more than you.\"", "That was little consolation for Ms Edyvane, who, with a young daughter and a baby on the way, was desperate to find a place of her own.", "\"I created a spreadsheet so we could figure out what was worth going to, what was worth actually inspecting and what was going to go significantly over, because it was just too exhausting going to houses that we weren't actually any shot for,\" she said.", "The spreadsheet was a comprehensive rundown of all the listed properties in Melbourne's outer eastern suburbs, the land size, bedroom count, location and the eventual cost of the property.\u00a0", "Using that data, Ms Edyvane said\u00a0she was able to determine which type of houses would typically sell for over the quote and she was able to target properties she believed were more accurately priced.", "On Saturday, her plan succeeded, and she was able to purchase her first home.\u00a0", "\"If we didn't have that spreadsheet we'd be lost, because it's just confusing trying to find out what's within our range and trying to work out what we can buy and what we can't,\" she said.", "\"It was just a lot of relief that we didn't keep having to go through this process because it's heart breaking. You find a place that you love and you just keep getting knocked back.\"", "Watch this story tonight on 7.30 on ABC TV and iview."]
